question.text: Two electric dipoles of dipole moments <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> are placed in two difference uniform electric fields of strengths <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>15</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> respectively. The ratio of maximum torque experienced by the electric dipoles will be <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>. The value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> is _____ .

solution.text:
Maximum torque experienced by an electric dipole is τmax=PEsin90°.

So, τmax=PE

The ratio is τ1τ2=P1E1P2E2=1.2×10-30×5×1042·4×10-30×15×104=16
 

Hence, the value of x=6.
